onset.Description: timepoint that stimulus appears on screen that matches scan timeseries

duration.Description: fixed period of time during which go stimulus was on screen

correct_response.Notes: 89 was coded for index finger responses, 71 for middle finger responses. This does not reflect stop signal trials and only pertains to choice answers.

key_press.Notes: 89 was coded for index finger responses, 71 for middle finger responses

stop_response.Description: which condition (key) they should withhold response to

stopped.Description: whether participant did not respond on trial

Levels.noncrit_signal: stop signal was shown, but stimulus was not critical (participant should respond)
Levels.crit_stop_success: stop signal was shown on critical stimulus, and participant successfully witheld response
Levels.crit_stop_failure: stop signal was shown on critical stimulus, but participant did not withold response
Levels.noncrit_nosignal: stop signal was not shown, and stimulus was not critical (participant should respond)
Levels.crit_go: stop signal was not shown on critical stimulus (participant should respond)
